page.title: 06Transport Around Nantwich.
page.content: {Railway}Station:unmanned station in Wellington road , on the line from Crewe to Shrewsbury and Cardiff.It is not a junction,all major connections are made at Crewe Bus Services:provided by Crosville from a small bus station in Beam Street.Services to Chester,Newcastle under Lyme,Crewe,Audlem and many surrounding villages. {Canals:}the main Shropshire Union Canal is joined from the west by the Llangollen Canal and from North East the Middlewich Branch connects the Shropshire Union to the Trent and Mersey Canal.Originally for commercial transport but now the canal is only used for pleasure craft. {Roads:}Nantwich is a route centre of considerable importance.Eight major roads converge on Nantwich and the town is within 10miles of the M6.
